body.name: Boys of Courage: A WW2 Historical Novel, Based on a True Story of a Jewish Holocaust Survivor (Heroic Children of World War II)

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 1, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A good read
reviews.reviewText: A real eye opener for what happens to survivors of the holocaust after the war. And how they go to find a new life.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 27, 2023
reviews.reviewText: This is not an easy book to read, but it is an important one. The Holocaust is depicted not as graphically as in some books I have read, but in a way that opened my mind to not just the physical atrocities to those who didn’t survive, but the mental & emotional damage to those who did.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 5, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars I have no words
reviews.reviewText: To truly voice my emotions, knowledge shared and absorbed. I have ready many survivors stories and they have all touched and humbled me, yet this story touched me in a different way. The story of a devoted son and friend, a just and honest man, generous, strong yet fragile. Reading the book, I wanted more for Kadish, the love for Sonya reciprocated, peace of mind and soul. Thank you for sharing his amazing story.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 19, 2024
reviews.reviewText: A book for the ages. Least we never forget. A writing of strength, determination, sorrow, and self-reflection of our trust and belief in spirituality and humanity.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 20, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars A book that says a lot ...
reviews.reviewText: I read a lot of books on the Holocaust, but found this less engaging than usual. This book needed a good edit: there were missing words, assorted typos, etc. which drew me out of the story. Also, I found the story to be a bit choppy, and was left wondering what was truth and what was fiction.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 9, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Gripping and emlotional
reviews.reviewText: Incredible dive into the unimaginable horror and terror of the Warsaw ghetto and WWII Holocaust for the survivors. Beautifully written. But I for one still do believe in miracles!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 7, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Amazing Brave Survivors
reviews.reviewText: Reading about these resilient young boys, who worked to get food for their families, was amazing. Some worked with the resistance group and then trying to find their families. Learning about the affects the Holocaust had on their lives and their achievements was very interesting ,

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 11, 2023
reviews.reviewText: What a perfect name for a book for indeed these were Boys of Courage. This book has tried to delve into the deeper meaning of the holocaust. When looking for deeper meaning and reasons there does not seem to be one answer. God Bless these poor people.

reviews.reviewTitle: Excellent Account of the Holocaust and Aftermath
reviews.reviewText: While I didn’t enjoy this novel as it wasn’t a fun story to read, I deeply respect it. I have never read such an honest account of the Holocaust and its aftermath. This novel raised many questions for me to ponder. Questions I never thought of before. The author also introduced me to ideas I had not thought of. Some I understood some I didn’t. As a lover and student of History, WW11 and the Holocaust are topics I am deeply interested in. After all I have read, I still don’t understand how the German army could conceive and carry out the ‘the final solution’. How could the German people stand by and let it happen? Reading some of the terrible things ordinary soldiers did to Jewish people filled me with horror. How could one person do that to another? This is an excellent book to read! Very interesting and thought provoking. I only wish Kaddish could have lived long enough to meet his cousin again.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on January 25, 2024
reviews.reviewText: A remarkable book you can't imagine how third people suffered even the ones who survived but it definitely provoked feelings very well written and emotional read hope it never happens again
A very captivating novel. It brings the events of the Holocaust to life, and helps one to understand what really happened. Well written!

One can not begin to comprehend what happened in the concentration camps of the Germans. Books like Boys of Courage give us the reader a small glimpse into the horror that the Jewish prisoners experienced. And the long term consequences that survivors still live with. Thank you for giving me a small glimpse into your experiences. I admire your courage to be able to share those experiences with all the pain and sorrow of sharing the memories you shared.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on April 29, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Good book, telling the story of young boys during the war, through to adulthood and the way the war changed all their lives.
